lskvs.c

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #include "pgpmac.h"
00010 //
00011 // Storage for the key value pairs
00012 //
00013 // the k's and v's are strings and to keep the memory management less crazy
00014 // we'll calloc some space for these strings and only free and re-calloc if we need
00015 // more space later.  Only the values are ever going to be resized.
00016 //
00017 typedef struct lskvs_kvs_struct {
00018   struct lskvs_kvs_struct *next;        
00019   pthread_rwlock_t l;                   
00020   char *k;                              
00021   char *v;                              
00022   int   vl;                             
00023 } lskvs_kvs_t;
00024 
00025 static lskvs_kvs_t *lskvs_kvs = NULL;   
00026 static pthread_rwlock_t lskvs_rwlock;   
00027 
00028 
00029 //
00030 // Set the value of a kv pair
00031 // Create the pair if the key does not exsist.
00032 //
00033 // If more than one thread tries to create the same key at the same time
00034 // it is possible for the list to contain multiple versions.  Not good.  But
00035 // also not possible if only one thread has the job of create the pairs in the first
00036 // place.  Alternatively just grab the write lock at the beginning 
00037 // and hold it until the end.  The advantage of having only one thread calling lskvs_set
00038 // is that it wont slow down the other threads that just want to read things.
00039 // In any case, we'll likely never see so much action for any of this to make a differene.
00040 //
00041 void lskvs_set( char *k, char *v) {
00042   lskvs_kvs_t
00043     *root,
00044     *p;
00045 
00046   lslogging_log_message( "lskvs_set:  k: '%s', v: '%s'", k, v);
00047 
00048   // Don't bother with empty keys
00049   //
00050   if( k == NULL || *k == 0)
00051     return;
00052 
00053   pthread_rwlock_rdlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00054   root = lskvs_kvs;
00055   pthread_rwlock_unlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00056 
00057   for( p=root; p != NULL; p = p->next) {
00058     if( strcmp( p->k, k) == 0) {
00059       break;
00060     }
00061   }
00062 
00063   if( p == NULL) {
00064     //
00065     // Add a new list item
00066     //
00067     p = calloc( 1, sizeof( *p));
00068     if( p == NULL) {
00069       lslogging_log_message( "lskvs_set: out of memory for kv struct (%d bytes", sizeof( *p));
00070       exit( -1);
00071     }
00072 
00073 
00074     p->k = calloc( strlen(k)+1, sizeof( *k));
00075     if( p->k == NULL) {
00076       lslogging_log_message( "lskvs_set: out of memory for k (%d bytes)", strlen( k)+1);
00077       exit( -1);
00078     }
00079     strcpy( p->k, k);
00080     p->k[strlen(k)] = 0;
00081 
00082     // leave a little room to grow
00083     //
00084     if( v == NULL || *v == 0)
00085       p->vl = 32;
00086     else
00087       p->vl = strlen(v) + 32;
00088 
00089     p->v = calloc( p->vl, sizeof( *v));
00090     if( p->v == NULL) {
00091       lslogging_log_message( "lskvs_set: out of memory for v (%d bytes)", p->vl);
00092       exit( -1);
00093     }
00094     
00095     if( v == NULL || *v == 0)
00096       *(p->v) = 0;
00097     else
00098       strcpy( p->v, v);
00099 
00100     p->v[p->vl-1] = 0;
00101     
00102     pthread_rwlock_init( &p->l, NULL);
00103 
00104     pthread_rwlock_wrlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00105     p->next   = lskvs_kvs;
00106     lskvs_kvs = p;
00107     pthread_rwlock_unlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00108   } else {
00109     //
00110     // Just update the value
00111     // Assume the database only sent us an update because
00112     // the old and new values are different
00113     //
00114     pthread_rwlock_wrlock( &(p->l));
00115     if( strlen( v) > p->vl-1) {
00116       free( p->v);
00117       
00118       p->vl = strlen(v) + 32;
00119       p->v = calloc( p->vl, 1);
00120       if( p->v == NULL) {
00121         lslogging_log_message( "lskvs_set: out of memory for re-calloc of v (%d bytes)", p->vl);
00122         exit( -1);
00123       }
00124     }
00125     strcpy( p->v, v);
00126     p->v[p->vl-1] = 0;
00127     pthread_rwlock_unlock( &(p->l));
00128   }
00129 }
00130 
00134 lskvs_kvs_t *lskvs_get(
00135                        char *k  
00136                        ) {
00137   lskvs_kvs_t
00138     *rtn;
00139 
00140   pthread_rwlock_rdlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00141   rtn = lskvs_kvs;
00142   pthread_rwlock_unlock( &lskvs_rwlock);
00143 
00144   while(rtn != NULL) {
00145     if( strcmp( rtn->k, k) == 0)
00146       break;
00147     rtn = rtn->next;
00148   }
00149   return rtn;
00150 }
00151 
00152 
00153 void lskvs_init() {
00154   pthread_rwlock_init( &lskvs_rwlock, NULL);
00155 }
00156 
00157 void lskvs_run() {
00158 }
